_header: This Summoner in his stirrups high stood
_description: Geoffrey Chaucer, the Sommoner’s Prologue of the Canterbury Tales — 44 lines in rhyming couplets.

BodArcSelB14.First Lines:
This sompnour in his stiropis high stoodvppon this frere his herte
                    was so wood…
BodArcSelB14.Last Lines:
…god saue yow alle saue this cursed freremy prolog wil I ende
                    in this manere
BodArcSelB14.Attributed Title:
…And next / folwyng biginneth the sompour his prolog (f.
                        105v); the sompnour (RT); Here endith the sompnour is
                    Prolog… (f. 106v)

BodBar20.First Lines:
This Sompnour in his stirop hygh stodeVpon þis ffrere his hert
                    was so woode…
BodBar20.Last Lines:
…God saue ȝow alle saue þis Cursed frereMyn prolog
                    wol I ende in þis manere

Bod414.First Lines:
[T]his Somonour in his stiropis high he stoodVpon this frere his
                    hert was so wood…
Bod414.Last Lines:
…God saue you alle saue this cursid frereMy prolog wil I ende
                    in this manere

Bod686.First Lines:

                    hert was so wodde…
Bod686.Last Lines:
…God save you alle save þis cursed frereMy prologe wol y
                    ende in þis manere
Bod686.Attributed Title:
…And here / begynneth the Somnours tale (f. 91); Somnoure (RT); Here
                    endeth the prolage of the / Somnours tale… (f. 91v)

Lincoln110.First Lines:

                    his herte was was
ner wod…
Lincoln110.Last Lines:
